</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	State the aggregate market value of the voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates computed by reference to the price at which the common equity was last sold as of the
	last business day of the registrant&#146;s most recently completed second fiscal quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	As of June&nbsp;30,
	2016&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$1,558,351,487
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Indicate the number of shares outstanding of each of the registrant&#146;s classes of common stock, as of the latest
	practicable date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	As&nbsp;of&nbsp;February&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2017&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Common&nbsp;Stock,&nbsp;$0.01 par value per
	share&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;137,169,663 shares
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	DOCUMENTS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Portions of the
	definitive proxy statement relating to the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc., which will be filed within 120 days of December&nbsp;31, 2016, are incorporated by reference in Part III of this report.
</FONT>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D236529D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	PART I
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
<A NAME="D236529D10K_HTM_TX236529_3">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Business.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc. provides contract drilling services to the energy industry around the
	globe with a fleet of 24 offshore drilling rigs. Our current fleet consists of four drillships, 19 semisubmersible rigs, and one jack-up rig.
<I>
	See
</I>
	&#147;&#151;&nbsp;Our Fleet&nbsp;&#151;
<I>
	&nbsp;Fleet Enhancements and Additions
</I>
	&#148; and
	&#147;&#151;&nbsp;Our Fleet
<I>
	&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Floater Fleet Status
</I>
	.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Unless the context otherwise
	requires, references in this report to &#147;Diamond Offshore,&#148; &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us&#148; or &#147;our&#148; mean Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc. and our consolidated subsidiaries. Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc. was incorporated in
	Delaware in 1989.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Our Fleet
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our diverse fleet enables us to offer a broad range of services worldwide, primarily in the floater market (ultra-deepwater, deepwater and mid-water).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Floaters
</I>
	. A floater rig is a type of mobile offshore drilling unit that floats and does not rest on the seafloor.
	This asset class includes self-propelled drillships and semisubmersible rigs. Semisubmersible rigs consist of an upper working and living deck resting on vertical columns connected to lower hull members. Such rigs operate in a
	&#147;semi-submerged&#148; position, remaining afloat, off bottom, in a position in which the lower hull is approximately 55 feet to 90 feet below the water line and the upper deck protrudes well above the surface. Semisubmersibles hold position
	while drilling by use of a series of small propulsion units or thrusters that provide dynamic positioning, or DP, to keep the rig on location, or with anchors tethered to the sea bed. Although DP semisubmersibles are self-propelled, such rigs may be
	moved long distances with the assistance of tug boats. Non-DP, or moored, semisubmersibles require tug boats or the use of a heavy lift vessel to move between locations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	A drillship is an adaptation of a maritime vessel that is designed and constructed to carry out drilling operations by means of a substructure with a moon pool centrally located in the
	hull. Drillships are typically self-propelled and are positioned over a drillsite through the use of a DP system similar to those used on semisubmersible rigs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our floater fleet (semisubmersibles and drillships) can be further categorized based on the nominal water depth for each class of rig as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_2"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="16%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="22%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="7%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="8%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:30PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Category
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Rated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Water Depth
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	(a)
</SUP>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

</TD>

</TD>

	5,000 to 7,500
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Mid-Water
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	400 to 4,999
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #343132;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
</B>
	Rated water depth for semisubmersibles and drillships reflects the maximum water depth in which a floating rig has been designed to operate.
	However, individual rigs are capable of drilling, or have drilled, in marginally greater water depths depending on various conditions (such as salinity of the ocean, weather and sea conditions).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	3
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	(a)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Represents year rig was built and originally placed in service or year rig was redelivered with significant enhancements that enabled
	the rig to be classified within a different floater category than originally constructed.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">

	(b)
</SUP>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">

	GOM means U.S. Gulf of Mexico.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">

	(c)

	For ease of presentation in this table, customer names have been shortened or abbreviated.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	(d)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	In August 2016, our subsidiary received notice of termination of its drilling contract from Petr&oacute;leo Brasileiro S.A., or
	Petrobras. In the same month, we filed a lawsuit in Brazil, claiming that Petrobras&#146; purported termination of the contract was unlawful and requesting an injunction to prohibit the contract termination. In September 2016, a Brazilian court
	issued a preliminary injunction, suspending Petrobras&#146; purported termination of the contract and ordering that the contract remain in effect until the end of the term or further court order. Petrobras has appealed the granting of the
	injunction. We do not believe that Petrobras had a valid or lawful basis for terminating the contract, and we intend to continue to defend our rights under the contract.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D236529D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Jack-ups
</I>
	. Jack-up rigs are mobile, self-elevating drilling platforms
	equipped with legs that are lowered to the ocean floor. Our jack-up is used for drilling in water depths from 20 feet to 350 feet. As of January&nbsp;30, 2017, the
<I>
	Ocean Scepter
</I>
	, a cantilevered jack-up drilling rig built in 2008, was offshore
	Mexico where it was waiting to commence a short-term contract for Fieldwood Energy. The
<I>
	Ocean Spur
</I>
	, which was reported as held for sale at the end of 2016, is expected to be sold in the near future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Fleet Enhancements and Additions
</I>
	. Our long-term strategy is to upgrade our fleet to meet customer demand for
	advanced, efficient and high-tech rigs by acquiring or building new rigs when possible to do so at attractive prices, and otherwise by enhancing the capabilities of our existing rigs at a lower cost and shorter construction period than newbuild
	construction would require.&nbsp;Since 2009, commencing with the acquisition of two newbuild, ultra-deepwater semisubmersible rigs, the
<I>
	Ocean Courage
</I>
	and
<I>
	Ocean Valor
</I>
	, we have spent over $5.0 billion towards upgrading our fleet. In
	2016, we took delivery of the
<I>
	Ocean GreatWhite
</I>
	, the final rig to be completed during our most recent fleet enhancement cycle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	We will evaluate further rig acquisition and enhancement opportunities as they arise. However, we can provide no assurance whether, or to what extent, we will continue to make rig
	acquisitions or enhancements to our fleet. See &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations &#151; Cash Flow and Capital Expenditures&#148; in Item&nbsp;7 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Pressure Control by the
	Hour
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</I>
	. During 2016, we entered into a ten-year agreement with a subsidiary of GE Oil&nbsp;&amp; Gas, or GE, to provide us services with respect to certain blowout
	preventer and related well control equipment on our four drillships.&nbsp;Such services include management of maintenance, certification and reliability with respect to such equipment.&nbsp;In connection with the services agreement with GE, we sold
	the equipment to a GE affiliate and have leased back such equipment under four separate ten-year operating leases.&nbsp;Collectively, we refer to the services agreement with GE and the lease agreements with the GE affiliate as the &#147;PCbtH
	program.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">

</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	We actively market our rigs worldwide. From time to time our fleet operates in various other markets throughout the world. See Note 18 &#147;Segments and Geographic Area Analysis&#148; to
	our Consolidated Financial Statements in Item&nbsp;8 of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Offshore Contract Drilling Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our contracts to provide offshore drilling services vary in their terms and provisions. We typically obtain our contracts
	through a competitive bid process, although it is not unusual for us to be awarded drilling contracts following direct negotiations. Our drilling contracts generally provide for a basic dayrate regardless of whether or not drilling
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	5
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D236529D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	results in a productive well. Drilling contracts generally also provide for reductions in rates during periods when the rig is being moved or when drilling operations are interrupted or
	restricted by equipment breakdowns, adverse weather conditions or other circumstances. Under dayrate contracts, we generally pay the operating expenses of the rig, including wages and the cost of incidental supplies. Historically, dayrate contracts
	have accounted for the majority of our revenues. In addition, from time to time, our dayrate contracts may also provide for the ability to earn an incentive bonus from our customer based upon performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	The duration of a dayrate drilling contract is generally tied to the time required to drill a single well or a group of
	wells, in what we refer to as a well-to-well contract, or a fixed period of time, in what we refer to as a term contract. Many drilling contracts may be terminated by the customer in the event the drilling unit is destroyed or lost, or if drilling
	operations are suspended for an extended period of time as a result of a breakdown of equipment or, in some cases, due to events beyond the control of either party to the contract. Certain of our contracts also permit the customer to terminate the
	contract early by giving notice; in most circumstances this requires the payment of an early termination fee by the customer. The contract term in many instances may also be extended by the customer exercising options for the drilling of additional
	wells or for an additional length of time, generally at competitive market rates and mutually agreeable terms at the time of the extension. In periods of decreasing demand for offshore rigs, drilling contractors may prefer longer term contracts to
	preserve dayrates at existing levels and ensure utilization, while customers may prefer shorter contracts that allow them to more quickly obtain the benefit of declining dayrates. Moreover, drilling contractors may accept lower dayrates in a
	declining market in order to obtain longer-term contracts and add backlog. See &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	We may not be able to renew or replace expiring contracts for our rigs,
</I>
	&#148; &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	Our business involves numerous
	operating hazards that could expose us to significant losses and significant damage claims. We are not fully insured against all of these risks and our contractual indemnity provisions may not fully protect us,
</I>
	&#148; &#147;Risk Factors
<I>
	&#151;
	We can provide no assurance that our drilling contracts will not be terminated early or that our current backlog of contract drilling revenue will be ultimately realized,
</I>
	&#148; &#147;Risk Factors
<I>
	&#151; We may enter into drilling contracts
	that expose us to greater risks than we normally assume
</I>
	&#148; and &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	We self-insure for physical damage to rigs and equipment caused by named windstorms in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;1A of this
	report, which are incorporated herein by reference. For a discussion of our contract backlog, see &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations &#151; Market Overview &#151;
<I>
	Contract Drilling
	Backlog
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;7 of this report, which is incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	We provide offshore drilling services to a customer base that includes major and independent oil and gas companies and
	government-owned oil companies. During 2016, 2015 and 2014, we performed services for 18, 19 and 35 different customers, respectively. During 2016, 2015 and 2014, our most significant customers were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Anadarko
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	No other customer accounted for 10% or more of our annual total consolidated revenues
	during 2016, 2015 or 2014. See &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	Our industry is highly competitive, with oversupply and intense price competition
</I>
	&#148; and &#147;Risk Factors&nbsp;&#151;
<I>
	Our customer base is concentrated&#148;
</I>
	in Item&nbsp;1A
	of this report, which are incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	As of January&nbsp;1, 2017, our contract backlog
	was $3.6 billion attributable to 11 customers. All four of our drillships are currently contracted to work in the GOM. As of January&nbsp;1, 2017, contract backlog attributable to our expected operations in the GOM was $639.0 million, $653.0
	million, $554.0 million and $85.0 million for the years 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020, respectively, all of which was attributable to two customers. See &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	&#151; Market Overview &#151;
<I>
	Contract Drilling Backlog
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;7 of this report. See &#147;Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	6
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D236529D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Factors &#151;
<I>
	We can provide no assurance that our drilling contracts will not be terminated early or that our current backlog of contract drilling revenue will be ultimately
	realized
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;1A of this report, which is incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Competition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Despite consolidation in previous years, the offshore contract drilling industry remains highly competitive with numerous
	industry participants, none of which at the present time has a dominant market share. The industry may also experience additional consolidation in the future, which could create other large competitors. Some of our competitors may have greater
	financial or other resources than we do. Based on industry data, as of the date of this report, there are approximately 830 mobile drilling rigs in service worldwide, including approximately 290 floater rigs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	The offshore contract drilling industry is influenced by a number of factors, including global economies and demand for
	oil and natural gas, current and anticipated prices of oil and natural gas, expenditures by oil and gas companies for exploration and development of oil and natural gas and the availability of drilling rigs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Drilling contracts are traditionally awarded on a competitive bid basis. Price is typically the primary factor in
	determining which qualified contractor is awarded a job. Customers may also consider rig availability and location, a drilling contractor&#146;s operational and safety performance record, and condition and suitability of equipment. We believe we
	compete favorably with respect to these factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
</I>
	We compete on a worldwide basis, but competition may
	vary significantly by region at any particular time. See &#147;&#151;&nbsp;Markets.&#148; Competition for offshore rigs generally takes place on a global basis, as these rigs are highly mobile and may be moved, although at a cost that may be
	substantial, from one region to another. It is characteristic of the offshore drilling industry to move rigs from areas of low utilization and dayrates to areas of greater activity and relatively higher dayrates. The current oversupply of offshore
	drilling rigs also intensifies price competition. See &#147;Risk Factors&nbsp;&#151;
<I>
	Our industry is highly competitive, with oversupply and intense price competition&#148;
</I>
	in Item&nbsp;1A of this report, which is incorporated herein by
	reference.
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Governmental Regulation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our operations are subject to numerous international, foreign, U.S., state and local laws and regulations that relate directly or indirectly to our operations, including regulations
	controlling the discharge of materials into the environment, requiring removal and clean-up under some circumstances, or otherwise relating to the protection of the environment, and may include laws or regulations pertaining to climate change,
	carbon emissions or energy use. See &#147;Risk Factors&nbsp;&#151;
<I>
	We are subject to extensive domestic and international laws and regulations that could significantly limit our business activities and revenues and increase our costs
</I>
	&#148;
	and &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	Compliance with or breach of environmental laws can be costly and could limit our operations
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;1A of this report, which are incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Operations Outside the United States
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our operations outside the U.S. accounted for approximately 66%, 79% and 85% of our total consolidated revenues for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. See
	&#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	Significant portions of our operations are conducted outside the United States and involve additional risks not associated with United States domestic operations
</I>
	,&#148; &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	We may enter into
	drilling contracts that expose us to greater risks than we normally assume,
</I>
	&#148; &#147;Risk Factors &#151;
<I>
	We may be required to accrue additional tax liability on certain of our foreign earnings
</I>
	&#148; and &#147;Risk Factors&nbsp;&#151;
<I>
	Fluctuations in exchange rates and nonconvertibility of currencies could result in losses to us
</I>
	&#148; in Item&nbsp;1A of this report, which are incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
	Employees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had
	approximately 2,800 workers, including international crew personnel furnished through independent labor contractors.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Marc Edwards
</I>
	has served as our President and Chief Executive Officer and as a
	Director since March 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Edwards previously served as a member of the Executive Committee and as Senior Vice President of the Completion and Production Division at Halliburton Company, a global diversified oilfield services company, from
	January 2010 to February 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	David L. Roland
</I>
	has served as our Senior Vice President, General
	Counsel and Secretary since September 2014. From April 2004 until joining us in 2014, Mr.&nbsp;Roland served as Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary of ION Geophysical Corporation, a NYSE-listed geophysical company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Thomas Roth
</I>
	has served as our Senior Vice President &#151; Worldwide Operations since December 2016.
	Mr.&nbsp;Roth previously served as Vice President of the Boots&nbsp;&amp; Coots Product Service Line at Halliburton Company from July 2013 to September 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Roth also served as Boots&nbsp;&amp; Coots Global Operations Manager at
	Halliburton Company from August 2011 to July 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Ronald Woll
</I>
	has served as our Senior Vice President
	and Chief Commercial Officer since June 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Woll previously served as Senior Vice President &#151; Supply Chain at Halliburton Company from January 2011 through June 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Kelly Youngblood
</I>
	has served as our Senior Vice President and our Chief Financial Officer since May 2016.
	Mr.&nbsp;Youngblood previously served as Vice President, Investor Relations at Halliburton Company from January 2013 to April 2016. From September 2011 to December 2012, Mr.&nbsp;Youngblood served as Senior Director, Investor Relations at
	Halliburton Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
	Beth G. Gordon
</I>
	has served as our Vice President and Controller since January 2017
	and previously served as our Controller since April 2000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">

	Access to Company Filings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	We are subject to the informational requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or the Exchange Act,
	and accordingly file annual, quarterly and current reports, any amendments to those reports, proxy statements and other information with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission, or SEC. You may read and copy the information we file with
	the SEC at the public reference facilities maintained by the SEC at 100 F Street, N.E., Washington, DC 20549. Please call the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330 for further information on the operation of the public reference room. Our SEC filings are also
	available to the public from the SEC&#146;s Internet site at www.sec.gov or from our Internet site at www.diamondoffshore.com. Our website provides a hyperlink to a third-party SEC filings website where these reports may be viewed and printed at no
	cost as soon as reasonably practicable after we have electronically filed such material with, or furnished it to, the SEC. The preceding Internet addresses and all other Internet addresses

</EFX_BUSINESS>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<B>
<A NAME="D236529D10K_HTM_TX236529_4">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1A. &nbsp;&nbsp;Risk Factors.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Our business is subject to a variety of risks and
	uncertainties. If any of these risks or uncertainties actually occur, our business, financial condition, results of operations and cash flows, and the trading prices of our securities, may be materially and adversely affected. You should carefully
	consider these risks when evaluating us and our securities. We have described below the most significant risks and uncertainties facing us; however, these risks and uncertainties are not the only ones facing our company. We are also subject to a
	variety of risks that affect many other companies generally, as well as additional risks and uncertainties not known to us or that, as of the date of this report, we believe are not as significant as the risks described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#343132">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	The worldwide demand for drilling services has declined significantly as a result of the decline in oil prices, which
	commenced during the second half of 2014 and has continued into 2017.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Demand for our drilling
	services depends in large part upon the oil and natural gas industry&#146;s offshore exploration and production activity and expenditure levels, which are directly affected by oil and gas prices and market expectations of potential changes in oil
	and gas prices. Commencing in the second half of 2014, oil prices have declined precipitously, falling to a 12-year low of less than $30 per barrel in January 2016. Oil prices have recently rebounded to some extent, but continue to exhibit
	day-to-day volatility. The dramatic reduction in commodity prices has caused a sharp decline in the demand for offshore drilling services, including services that we provide and adversely affected our results of operations and cash flows in 2015 and
	2016, compared to previous years. A prolonged period of low oil prices would have a material adverse effect on many of our customers and, therefore, on demand for our services and on our financial condition, results of operations and cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	Oil prices have been, and are expected to continue to be, volatile and are affected by numerous factors
	beyond our control, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#343132">
	worldwide supply and demand for oil and gas;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	the level of economic activity in energy-consuming markets;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
